nodes.text: Citadel Station was built in 3955 BBY to serve as the living and working quarters of the Telosian Restoration Project. As of 3951 BBY the Citadel Station swoop track was considered by many to be state of the art due to its recent construction. The circuit was designed to incorporate the new advancements in both swoop racing and the improvements in swoop bike construction. This was most clearly evidenced by the use of repulsorlift technology that offered vertical challenges, demanding a high level of skill and precision from the racer.
